title: Noatak National Preserve: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park                   Discover the true meaning of wilderness               Learn about subsistence use in Noatak               Noatak: one of the last unspoiled river basins               Learn about the animals that call Noatak home             News Stay up-to-date with the latest news from Noatak National Preserve. Photos and More You don't have to come to Noatak National Preserve to enjoy its beauty. Check out our photo galleries, videos and research blog to experience Noatak from the comfort of your home. History and Culture Noatak National Preserve has been home to the Inupiaq Eskimo for over 11,000 years. Much of what we know about their history has been preserved in the oral history of the Inupiat people. Nature Noatak National Preserve protects the nation’s largest unaltered river basin and watershed. Learn about this vast wilderness and the animals that make it their home. For Teachers Discover how you can use Noatak National Preserve to teach students about biology and how scientists study wildlife. For Kids Become a Jr. Ranger at the Western Arctic National Parklands. Management Learn about the purpose of Noatak National Preserve and what we are protecting. Bookstore Peruse Alaska Geographic's selctions. Alaska Geographic is the non-profit partner of national parks throughout Alaska, and a portion of their proceeds go directly to the parks.
